problem_text:
Let G be a finite p-group in which every 2-generator subgroup has cyclic derived subgroup. Is the derived length of G bounded?
If p ≠ 2, then G^(2) = 1 (J. Alperin), but for p = 2 there are examples with G^(2) cyclic and elementary abelian of arbitrary order.
B. M. Veretennikov
answer: Yes, it is at most 4 (B. Wilkens, J. Group Theory, 17, no. 1 (2014), 151–174).
